event.name: Full-Frontal Comedy Showcase: Yuri Kagan | Castro
event.location: The Lookout,| 3600 16th St., San Francisco, CA
event.description: Yuri Kagan headlines Full  Frontal Comedy. Admission is $5, but get half off   if you  mention FunCheap at the door.
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Comedy , Eating & Drinking , San Francisco Full-Frontal Comedy Showcase: Yuri Kagan | Castro Thursday, June 18, 2015 - 8:00 pm to 10:00 pm | Cost: $5*
*Entrance is a suggested donation of $5. A portion of proceeds go to Margaret Cho's #BeRobin project to help San Francisco's homeless. The Lookout | 3600 16th St., San Francisco, CA Castro San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Full-Frontal Comedy Showcase | Castro Every third Thursday
of the month come out to the Lookout for Full-Frontal Comedy
Showcase at The Lookout in the Castro.
It’s the new comedy with a touch of drag variety show
all the kids are talking about hosted by comics Valerie Branch and Yuri Kagan. Entrance is a suggested donation of $5. A portion of proceeds go to Margaret Cho’s #BeRobin project to help San Francisco’s homeless. Thursday, June 18, 2015 Full-Frontal Comedy Showcase | Castro Yuri Kagan
headlines Full Frontal
Comedy.
Admission is $5, but get half off if you mention FunCheap
at the door. About the Performers: Headliner – Yuri Kagan
– is a nice Jewish boy – or at least that’s what it says on the JDate profile his mother created for him. Yuri is a dry-humor, observational, dead-pan comedian who talks about growing up with an entire family from the Soviet Union without holding anything back. He produces monthly comedy shows: Shit Talk at Oasis SF
, and is the co-producer of Full Frontal Comedy at Lookout
. He has been profiled in SF Weekly
and the Vallejo Daily Republic. He just published his first book Vodka and Limelight
. Pippi Lovestocking
- San Francisco’s Premiere Stand-Up Drag Diva
returns to Full Frontal
Comedy. A founding partner of Trannyshack
, Pippi Lovestocking is the drag persona of comedian Scott Free. Both Scott and Pippi are outrageous and artful in their comedic stories of growing up gay in North Carolina. His film and TV credits include Blue Velvet
and Looking, and he performs regularly at Cobb’s Comedy Club, The Punchline, and Rooster T. Feathers. Chey Bell
– Comedian, actress and TV host, Chey Bell stays true to her sign as the free spirited Sagittarius. Her quick witted personality is fuels her comedic routines and wins over audiences from LA to San Francisco. Carrie Avritt’s
edgy comedy lays at the intersection of humor and honesty; her philosophy is that no topic is off limits, as long as it’s funny – and she makes it her business to be hilarious. Carrie produced and hosted the Girl Power Comedy Night
as part of the Hella Gay Comedy Festival
in 2014, and performed at San Jose Pride
in 2012. Kelly Lynch
– This pint-sized comic packs a punch with her comedy. Don’t let her size or her adorable charm fool you, she’s a heavyweight on the comedy mic and is on the rise in the SF comedy scene. You’ll want to be able to say you were there when she was just starting out.
Co-producer & Host, Valerie Branch
is “The Den Mother of Bay Area Comedy”. Valerie produces and hosts the Sunday Funnies at Club 1220
in Walnut Creek, and hosts Branching Out With Valerie
on Ozcat Radio.
Additionally Valerie frequently performs in her drag queen persona as Pia Messing Upcoming Full-Frontal Comedy Showcase | Castro Events Thu 6/18 Full-Frontal Comedy Showcase: Yuri Kagan | Castro Thu 7/16 Full-Frontal Comedy Showcase | Castro Thu 8/20 Full-Frontal Comedy Showcase | Castro Report Error in Post Links: Event details Cost: $5* *Entrance is a suggested donation of $5. event.name: It’s Just 2 Minutes: Stand-Up Comedy Game Show | Haight
event.location: Milk Bar,| 1840 Haight Street, San Francisco, CA
event.description: It’s Just Two Minutes Format: At the end of Round 3, the audience will determine a winner. The winner receives all of the money in the Tip Jar of Justice and gets to perform some of their stand-up .
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Comedy , San Francisco It’s Just 2 Minutes: Stand-Up Comedy Game Show | Haight Tuesday, September 1, 2015 - 8:00 pm | Cost: FREE Milk Bar | 1840 Haight Street, San Francisco, CA Upper Haight San Francisco Add to Google Calendar It’s Just 2 Minutes: Stand-Up Comedy Game Show | Haight
Every first Tuesday at Milk Bar, San Francisco’s comedians are put to the test
as they are given a random series of words and sentences seconds before getting on stage, where they then must construct entire two minute sets around each.
This improv-standup hybrid then lets the audience pick the top performer at the end of the night
. The night is hosted by Josh Argyle.
It’s Just Two Minutes is a three round improvised stand-up comedy game-show
that couldn’t exist without you, the audience. 9 comics take turns improvising stand-up sets based on one or two word prompts presented to them as they individually take the stage.
It’s Just Two Minutes Format:
In Round
1, the comics are given a one or two word prompt
. They then improvise 2 minute of stand-up just for you, the audience. It’s 120 seconds of wit and hilarity. Round 2
is the story round
. Comics are given a simple prompt such as embarrassing story or bad date story then they open up to you, the audience, as you laugh uncontrollably at their awkward lives. Round 3
requires a little help from you, the audience. In this round, you provide several prompts to the comics. The comic will say “I like my women like I like my…” or “I like my men like I like my…” and you yell out whatever you want. Seriously…whatever you want. The comic will then complete the sentence with a punchline. For example, “I like my women like I like my table lamps…picked out by my mother.” This is a lightning round of skill and wit
.
At the end of Round 3, the audience will determine a winner. The winner receives all of the money in the Tip Jar of Justice and gets to perform some of their stand-up
. is a wild show that combines stand up comedy, improv, music
, and what they like to call “audience-participation-good-times”
typically happening at 8 pm every second Monday
.
The emcees for the evening are Justin Gomes and Andrew Moore. True fans of debauchery
, they’ve been co-hosting shows for years in a yin-and-yang mix of chaos and order that always yields the same results: party times. About Something Something Shindig:
A comedian will perform stand up comedy
After said comedian’s set, they will perform improv with hosts Andrew and Justin
Occasionally they will throw in big group games, audience shindigs, and weird stuff
Rinse, Repeat, Good Times Ensue Upcoming Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Events Mon 7/13 Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Mon 8/10 Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Mon 9/14 Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Report Error in Post Links: Event details Cost: FREE SHARE THIS POST Tweet 0

event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Eating & Drinking , Fun & Games , Literature , San Francisco , Theater & Performance Saturday Write Fever: Insta-Plays Written & Performed | SF Saturday, July 11, 2015 - 8:30 pm to 10:30 pm | Cost: FREE EXIT Theatre | 156 Eddy Street, San Francisco Tenderloin San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Saturday Write Fever: Insta-Plays Written & Performed | SF
Every second Saturday of the month, San Francisco Theater Pub
invites writers, actors, directors, theater creators and theater audiences alike to a free evening of quick script-making and flash-fried performance
.
Join them at the Exit Theatre for: 8:30 pm: Mixer 9 pm: Writing sprint
where writers have 30 minutes to generate original monologues based around that night’s pre-generated prompts 9:30 pm: Performance
of the work on stage in the café for an on-the-spot, one-night-only instant festival
They cast actors from the crowd (no experience necessary)
, so come join in the communal creativity, either as a writer, performer, or audience member
. There’s no need for reservations, though get there early to get your name on the writer list.
Hosted by local writers Stuart Bousel
and Megan Cohen
, admission to this event is free, with the café staying open and staffed, so you can purchase drinks and snacks all night long. *$8 when you mention FuncheapSF at the door; otherwise, it's $10 The Shelton Theatre | 533 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA Union Square / Downtown San Francisco Add to Google Calendar The Lit Slam: Page Meets Stage Poetry | SF The Lit Slam
is a monthly, live performance-based poetry anthology that tries to find the best art at the intersection of page and stage,
mixing local and national touring poets.
Every third Monday, it’s a poetry competition with a twist. Editors are chosen at random from the audience
before each show, and those editors decide which poets and poems will appear in Tandem, the annual publication created over the course of the season. The Lit Slam
Every Third Monday | Q&A Discussion at 7 pm; show at 8 pm

event.location: Powell & Post,| Powell St and Post St, San Francisco, CA
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » *Top Pick* , San Francisco , Walks & Tours Funky Tour of Wild SF History | Union Square
Dang! This event has already taken place. >> Want to see our Top Picks for this week instead? Sunday, June 14, 2015 - 10:30 am to 11:30 am | Cost: FREE*
*Tours are pay-what-you-wish, with a suggested donation of $10-15. Powell & Post | Powell St and Post St, San Francisco, CA Union Square / Downtown San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Funky Tour of Wild SF History | Union Square
The quirky, hip historians at Wild SF Tours
run a free tour of downtown’s scandalous history every Sunday morning.
Get ready for epic tales of Gold Rush millionaires, Hollywood disasters, the Great Earthquake of 1906, beloved red light ladies, infamous villains
and more, ending near Montgomery and Market. Great fun for locals and travelers alike.
No need to sign up, just meet at the heart statue at Powell and Post (Union Square)
for an awesome, energetic introduction to the city’s past with SF’s funkiest tour guides, “Best of SF” award winners Wild SF Tours. Tours are pay-what-you-wish, with a suggested donation of $10-15. event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Lectures & Workshops , San Francisco Mountain Lake Science Saturdays | Presidio Saturday, July 11, 2015 - 2:00 pm to 3:00 pm | Cost: FREE Mountain Lake (Presidio) | 202-394 Veterans Blvd., San Francisco, CA Presidio San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Mountain Lake Science Saturdays | Presidio
Mountain Lake Science Saturdays is a lively series of talks by scientists
studying topics relating to the San Francisco natural wonder, Mountain Lake
, and its ecological restoration.
On the second Saturday from May to October
, gather at the lake to hear researchers from a variety of disciplines talk on topics ranging from Archaeology to Zooplankton. Here’s your chance to ask the experts your questions about the science being done to save this lake. How to get there: Enter the Presidio on Park Presidio heading north and go just past Mountain Lake. Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » *Top Pick* , Art & Museums , Free Food , San Francisco Free Hot Dog Day | Inner Richmond Sunday, July 5, 2015 - 1:00 pm to 6:00 pm | Cost: FREE Frankenart Mart | 515 Balboa St., San Francisco, CA Western Addition San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Free Hot Dog Day | Inner Richmond
The Frankenart Mart
is a quirky “only in San Francisco” type of art gallery in the Inner Richmond. Not only do they have curious one-of-a-kind participatory art projects
, but once a month there’s free hot dogs
. Cat hair toppings are available.
Keep in mind, this is a teeny tiny (250 sq. feet) art gallery.
So if you’re interested in strange and wonderful little art projects,
this is a fun place to spend part of your Sunday and munch on a free dog. Free Hot Dog Day Usually
the first Sunday of the month | 1-6 pm ( check the schedule
)
Frankenart Mart, 515 Balboa St, San Francisco
FREE
Every month, Frankenart Mart gives away free beef and veggie dogs to all visitors who want one. There’s a bit of a rivalry going on between the two – scorewise.
Though veggie has come very close, beef has historically won out. Photos: Steve Rhodes Upcoming Free Hot Dog Day | Inner Richmond Events Sun 7/5 Free Hot Dog Day | Inner Richmond Report Error in Post Links: Event details Cost: FREE SHARE THIS POST Tweet 0

event.name: San Francisco Critical Mass
event.location: Justin Herman Plaza,| 1 Market Street, San Francisco, CA
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » San Francisco , Walks & Tours San Francisco Critical Mass Friday, June 26, 2015 - 5:30 pm | Cost: FREE Justin Herman Plaza | 1 Market Street, San Francisco, CA Embarcadero San Francisco Add to Google Calendar San Francisco Critical Mass
Critical Mass is a mass bicycle ride that takes place on the last Friday of each month
in San Francisco starting at 5:30 pm at Justin Herman Plaza
(foot of Market Street) and in cities around the world. Everyone is invited. No one is in charge. Bring your bike. Please Note: Critical Mass tends to practice extreme bike power by taking to the streets and riding in the car lanes causing endless annoyance to motorists . In San Francisco especially, this event can get HUGE. Consider this is fair warning to stay away from driving in the downtown SF area on the last Friday of every month. *Free for spectators. Car exhibitors will be charged $5 and will receive a free cup of coffee. Treasure Island Great Lawn | Avenue of the Palms and 6th Street, San Francisco, CA Treasure Island San Francisco Add to Google Calendar “Cars and Coffee”: Exotic & Muscle Car Meetup | Treasure Island Come and view some really special cars and interact with other car lovers at Cars and Coffee. Unlike other car shows, their fantastic turn out allows them to limit the cars to truly rare, unique, or exotic vehicles .
Cars and Coffee is held on the first Saturday of each month from 8-11 am
. Please check the Facebook group
for an up-to-date event info before heading out. Have a something you want to exhibit?
Cars and Coffee welcomes all owners of exotic cars, vintage European/Italian sports cars, pre-1972s American classic and muscle cars, and of course, electric sports cars. Due to the high cost of the space, exhibitors will be charged $5 and will receive a free cup of coffee. Enjoy free admission
to the Museum of Craft and Design
on the first Tuesday of every month
.
After six years in Union Square and two years of pop-ups, the Museum of Craft & Design
opened up their permanent location in the Dogpatch. Rather than featuring paintings or traditional sculpture, the museum showcases other types of artwork that range from furniture, kinetic sculptures, and jewelry. Located in SF’s Castro District, the GLBT History Museum
is the first full-scale, stand-alone museum of its kind in the United States. The museum celebrates 100 years of the city’s vast queer past through dynamic exhibitions and programming.
Normally admission is $5, but on the first Wednesday of every month
, admission is free. Upcoming GLBT History Museum: Free First Wednesdays | Castro Events Wed 7/1 GLBT History Museum: Free First Wednesdays | Castro Wed 8/5 GLBT History Museum: Free First Wednesdays | Castro Report Error in Post Links: Event details Cost: FREE SHARE THIS POST Tweet 0

*Free, but an RSVP is required. Sports Basement (Bryant St.) | 1590 Bryant Street, San Francisco, CA Mission District San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Free AcroYoga Workshop | Sports Basement Bryant
Join Ariel Mihic of the YogaSlackers for an AcroYoga
playshop from 10-10:50 am on most first Sundays of every month
in the Grotto at Sports Basement Bryant in San Francisco. Free
, but an RSVP
is required.
AcroYoga is a combination of yoga
, acrobatics
, and Thai massage
. This workshop will give you a taste of all of these elements while you work with partners to build a new sense of communication, trust, and community.
All levels are welcome and no partner is necessary
. This session will provide a safe environment for beginners, and also an opportunity for more experienced folks to sharpen their skills. 2015 Acroyoga Dates

*RSVP required to programs@soex.org (Attendance is limited to 16 participants) $5 materials fee; Kids over 12 welcome with an adult. Southern Exposure | 3030 20th Street, San Francisco, CA Mission District San Francisco Add to Google Calendar “Up In The Air” Whimsical Interactive Airship Construction Art Project | SF
Collaborate with renowned artist Bernie Lubell as he sets out to build an airship
in the gallery at Southern Exposure. In two workshops
and ongoing drop-in studio hours
, visitors and Bernie will work together to create an air powered flying machine
inspired by Frederick Marriott’s 1869 airship Avitor, expanding on Bernie’s ongoing research into breath and the force of air. Bernie Lubell creates unlikely wood mechanical metaphors for the human condition . Gears, pulleys, bellows, valves, levers , human force and sophisticated engineering power his interactive wooden machines . As an artist who has lived and worked in the Bay Area for 40 years, his influence is felt in the work of many local artists. “Up In The Air” Airship Building Schedule Exhibit Opening
| June 13, 2015, 1-6 pm Drop-in construction:
Tuesdays – Fridays, June 16-26, noon to 6 pm Workshop 1: Heart/Walk/Whistle | June 13, 2015, 1-5 pm RSVP required to programs@soex.org (Attendance is limited to 16 participants) $5 materials fee
When so much in San Francisco feels up in the air, join Bernie Lubell to explore the sense of being airborne. Each participant in this workshop will design and build a machine inspired by a trio of words culled from Bernie’s research into the feeling of weightlessly waiting to see which way the wind may blow. Workshop 2: Experimental Elevations | June 20, 1-5 pm RSVP required to programs@soex.org (Attendance is limited to 16 participants) $5 materials fee; Kids over 12 welcome with an adult.
Hand-construct mechanisms to generate hydrogen and hot air, which will be used to fill balloons and send them aloft. Part of Bernie Lubell’s exhibition Up In The Air. “Up In The Air” Closing Party  | June 26, 6-8 pm
Join Southern Exposure for a celebration of Bernie Lubell’s work and everything that we created together over the past two weeks during his exhibition Up In the Air. The Chinese Historical Society of America Museum
is situated in the heart of San Francisco’s Chinatown. Located in a historic building designed by renowned architect Julia Morgan, the museum introduces the rich history of the Chinese American experience. Come discover Chinatown’s unique and inspiring stories
.
Normally $5, the museum offers free admission on the first Thursday of every month. *FREE Town Center Corte Madera | 100 Corte Madera Town Center, Corte Madera, CA Corte Madera North Bay Add to Google Calendar Summer Outdoor Music Series | Corte Madera
Celebrating the summer season and Marin’s love for the outdoors Town Center Corte Madera will host its annual Summer Music Series
each Sunday June 7th through September 27th from 2-4 pm with a great lineup of music that will appeal to all ages.
The series features a wide variety of musical genres including blues, folk, jazz, Caribbean drums and classic rock
. Bring the family, enjoy restaurants and cafes, listen to live music and shop Town Center’s 68 stores. Summer Music Series Lineup:

event.description: The Presidio Trust’s Design Lab in 103 Montgomery will also be open on Sundays. Drop in to share your thoughts about the New Presidio Parklands Project, a magnificent 13-acre landscape that will integrate the waterfront with the Presidio’s historic Main Post.
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » **Annual Event** , *Top Pick* , Eating & Drinking , Fun & Games , Kids & Families , Live Music , San Francisco Off the Grid: Presidio Picnic & Food Truck Party | SF Sunday, June 14, 2015 - 11:00 am to 4:00 pm | Cost: FREE*
*Free admission, but bring money for food,  drinks and some entertainment. Main Post Lawn | 103 Montgomery Street, Main Post, Presidio, San Francisco, CA Presidio San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Off the Grid: Presidio Picnic & Food Truck Party | SF
Off the Grid hosts a full season of Picnic at the Presidio
from 11 am to 4 pm every Sunday through the fall at the Main Parade Ground Lawn.
Expect yummy offerings available for purchase from San Francisco’s favorite eateries and food trucks
, Mimosa and Bloody Mary drink kits,
and live music from an onsite DJ.
In addition to complimentary classic picnic amenities like bocce ball
, Off the Grid: Picnic at the Presidio offers yoga classes
from “The Pad” and kids yoga from “It’s Yoga Kids,” as well as game rentals
and activities from Sports Basement. Blankets and Adirondack chairs
are available to rent for a complete Picnic experience.
The Presidio Trust’s Design Lab in 103 Montgomery will also be open on Sundays. Drop in to share your thoughts about the New Presidio Parklands Project,
a magnificent 13-acre landscape that will integrate the waterfront with the Presidio’s historic Main Post. Off the Grid: Picnic at the Presidio
Every Sunday | March 1 – November 1, 2015 | 11 am to 4 pm
Main Parade Ground, The Presidio, SF

event.description: 2015 Laughter Yoga Class Dates
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Comedy , San Francisco , Sports & Fitness Free Laughter Yoga Class | UCSF Wednesday, December 23, 2015 - 5:30 pm to 6:30 pm | Cost: FREE UCSF Osher Center | 1545 Divisadero St, 5th Floor, San Francisco, CA Pacific Heights San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Free Laughter Yoga Class | UCSF Laughter
is contagious and has a powerful and immediate effect on our mind, body and spirit
. Laughter Yoga involves deep breathing, stretching, clapping and laughter exercises
and takes place on two Wednesdays each month from 5:30-6:30 pm. Free
, but an RSVP
is required.
The laughter exercises in this class aim to:
Increase blood flow and oxygen to all the major organs
Enhance endorphin levels which make us feel uplifted and can reduce pain
Stimulate immune, digestive and cardiac systems
Reduce stress levels
Relax, strengthen and lengthen the muscles with stretching
Help create a laughing community and be fun 2015 Laughter Yoga Class Dates

is a wild show that combines stand up comedy, improv, music
, and what they like to call “audience-participation-good-times”
typically happening at 8 pm every second Monday
.
The emcees for the evening are Justin Gomes and Andrew Moore. True fans of debauchery
, they’ve been co-hosting shows for years in a yin-and-yang mix of chaos and order that always yields the same results: party times. About Something Something Shindig:
A comedian will perform stand up comedy
After said comedian’s set, they will perform improv with hosts Andrew and Justin
Occasionally they will throw in big group games, audience shindigs, and weird stuff
Rinse, Repeat, Good Times Ensue Upcoming Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Events Mon 7/13 Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Mon 8/10 Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Mon 9/14 Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Report Error in Post Links: Event details Cost: FREE SHARE THIS POST Tweet 0

SpA Cars and Coffee SF | 599 The Embarcadero, San Francisco, CA Embarcadero San Francisco Add to Google Calendar “Cars and Coffee”: Exotic & Muscle Car Meetup | Treasure Island Come and view some really special cars and interact with other car lovers at Cars and Coffee. Unlike other car shows, their fantastic turn out allows them to limit the cars to truly rare, unique, or exotic vehicles .
Cars and Coffee is held on the first Saturday of each month from 8-11 am
. Please check the Facebook group
for an up-to-date event info before heading out. Have a something you want to exhibit?
Cars and Coffee welcomes all owners of exotic cars, vintage European/Italian sports cars, pre-1972s American classic and muscle cars, and of course, electric sports cars. Due to the high cost of the space, exhibitors will be charged $5 and will receive a free cup of coffee. event.name: Contemporary Jewish Museum Free Admission Day | First Tuesdays
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Art & Museums , Free Museum Day , San Francisco Contemporary Jewish Museum Free Admission Day | First Tuesdays Tuesday, July 7, 2015 - 11:00 am to 5:00 pm | Cost: FREE Add to Google Calendar Contemporary Jewish Museum Free Admission Day | First Tuesdays
The Contemporary Jewish Museum
engages audiences of all  backgrounds through dynamic exhibitions and programs that explore contemporary perspectives on Jewish culture
, history, art, and ideas. And the architecture of the Museum itself is a work of art.
Embracing a range of artistic disciplines
and media, the museum’s exhibition program includes contemporary art, historical objects, film, music, conversations, lectures, literary readings, and other live performances.
Normally admission is $12 for adults, but on the first Tuesday of each month
, admission is free. *Free, but there is a suggested donation of $5-$15 Cyprian’s | 2097 Turk St., San Francisco, CA NoPa San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Free Improv Class & BYOB Wednesday | SF
Come have fun and exercise your imagination and creativity at a monthly improv class
happening on the last Wednesday of the month
at the Turk and Lyon Community Center inside St. Cyprian’s. Free
, but there is a suggested donation of $5-$15
Whether you are a veteran or a novice, this class will get you into a place of silliness, absurdity
, and break you out of your day to day routine.
The class focuses on improv games
involving balls, bizarre stories, ridiculous movement, and the occasional song, ending with a few group ‘improv scene’ exercises. It’s BYOB
, but there’s also beer and wine for sale at the venue. Celebrating the summer season and Marin’s love for the outdoors Town Center Corte Madera will host its annual Summer Music Series
each Sunday June 7th through September 27th from 2-4 pm with a great lineup of music that will appeal to all ages.

Yerba Buena Center for the Arts | 701 Mission St, San Francisco, CA SoMa San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Yerba Buena Gallery Crawl: Third Thursdays | SoMa Yerba Buena Third Thursdays
is a monthly outing of art, performance, music, and drinks
in the Yerba Buena neighborhood in the heart of downtown San Francisco, between 2nd and 5th Street, and Market and Harrison Street. Free
, but an RSVP
is recommended to save time at check-in. Pre-register, and use your smart phone or printed ticket to get wristbands at participating art venues.
Yerba Buena neighborhood galleries, museums, restaurants, and bars will host an event every third Thursday of the month which will be an exciting chance to explore the Yerba Buena district.
Look for the yellow balloons for Third Thursday events, and be sure to pick up your wrist band at YBCA
for special rates at participating bars and restaurants. All gallery and museum admissions will be free,
except for the Contemporary Jewish Museum which will offer a special entry price of $5. Yerba Buena Third Thursdays

Celebrating the summer season and Marin’s love for the outdoors Town Center Corte Madera will host its annual Summer Music Series
each Sunday June 7th through September 27th from 2-4 pm with a great lineup of music that will appeal to all ages.
The series features a wide variety of musical genres including blues, folk, jazz, Caribbean drums and classic rock
. Bring the family, enjoy restaurants and cafes, listen to live music and shop Town Center’s 68 stores. Summer Music Series Lineup:

The San Francisco Amateur Astronomers
invite you to their next City Star Party,
where you can take a gander at our universe through telescopes, socialize with more experienced amateur astronomers
, and get some tips about the night sky. Take in the view
from San Francisco’s picturesque Land’s End or other fantastic view points like the Exploratorium, or Randall Museum. City Star Party
When: Generally monthly at sundown
Where: Rotating venues like Pt. Lobos, Randall Museum, Presidio or Pier 17
FREE >> Is it raining or cloudy
? Bad weather likely cancels, but check the SF Amateur Astronomer’s website

*Special Arrangement Evening Ferry Tickets are required: $49 Adults and $35 Children (5-12 years) Angel Island | Angel Island, San Francisco, CA Angel Island San Francisco Add to Google Calendar
Leave the crowds on the mainland behind and enjoy the fireworks from the Bay’s best seats
, Ayala Cove on Angel Island,
on July 4, 2015.
Before the fireworks, spend the afternoon at the Angel Island Cafe and Cantina with live music
, plus there will be food, beer, and wine for purchase. This special ticket includes round trip ferry service to Angel Island and round trip Tram ride from the Cove to Battery Ledyard for an unforgettable view of the fireworks show.
Special arrangement Evening Ferry Tickets
are required: $49 for Adult and $35 for Children (5-12 years). Yes, we know it’s spendy, but the view is guaranteed to be spectacular with panoramic views of fireworks from San Francisco, Marin County, and the East Bay. In the past tickets sold out several days before the event, so don’t sleep on this one. San Francisco’s Bayview Neighborhood comes alive for 3rd on Third
, a community-wide arts celebration for the whole family happening from 5-8 pm every third Friday of the month, at Bayview Town Center (3rd Street from McKinnon to Palou & Mendell Plaza).
The monthly event will feature pop-up galleries, food trucks, a beer and wine garden
, a special children’s zone with free art-making activities
, and a stage featuring Bayview talent. event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Geek Event , Lectures & Workshops , San Francisco Oceanside Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Outer Sunset Saturday, November 14, 2015 - 10:00 am to 12:30 pm | Cost: FREE*
*Free, but an RSVP is required. Oceanside Wastewater Treatment Plant | 3500 Great Hwy, San Francisco, CA Sunset District San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Bayview
The San Francisco Public Utilities Commission invites you to take a free tour
of the city’s Wastewater Treatment Plant
to find out how your sewer system works. Free
, but an RSVP
is required at least two days in advance.
You’ll learn about the history of wastewater treatment
in San Francisco, tips on preventing pollution
of our bay and ocean, and best of all, you’ll get to go behind the scenes
to see how this vital piece of infrastructure works. Visitors must be at least 10 years old to take the tour.
Tours alternate between the Oceanside Plant
in the Outer Sunset and the Southeast Plant
in Bayview. event.location: Conservatory of Flowers,| 100 John F Kennedy Dr, San Francisco, CA
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » *Top Pick* , Art & Museums , Free Museum Day , San Francisco Conservatory of Flowers: Free Admission Day Tuesday, July 7, 2015 - 10:00 am to 4:30 pm | Cost: FREE Conservatory of Flowers | 100 John F Kennedy Dr, San Francisco, CA Golden Gate Park San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Conservatory of Flowers: Free Admission Day
Whether you’re a native San Franciscan, a visitor from the other side of the world, or a budding botanist, the Conservatory of Flowers
offers an intimate, up-close experience with over 1,700 species of rare, exotic and endangered plants from more than 50 different countries.
Opened in 1879, the wood and glass greenhouse is the oldest existing conservatory of its kind in the Western Hemisphere.
Admission is normally $5 for SF residents ($8 for everyone else)
, but it’s free to all visitors on the first Tuesday of every month
. Hours:

is a niche comedy showcase created by Josef Anolin where comedians give you a piece of the darkest corners of their minds
while simultaneously being kept on their toes by the antics of the show’s resident Haters, Josef Anolin, Chris Riggins, Kaseem Bentley and Mimi Vilmenay.
It takes it’s inspiration from such shows as Tough Crowd with Colin Quinn and Chappelle’s Show “The Haters Ball”
sketch. To keep things fresh and unpredictable, the show’s format undergoes constant changes which includes occasional alternative performances
and participatory games with the comedians

event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » **Annual Event** , *Top Pick* , Club / DJ , Fairs & Festivals , KFOG , Live Music , Pride , San Francisco , San FranFREEsco , Theater & Performance 2015 San Francisco Pride Festival: Sunday | Civic Center Sunday, June 28, 2015 - All Day | Cost: FREE*
*Free, but a $5-10 donation is requested. Civic Center Plaza | Larkin St and Fulton St, San Francisco, CA Civic Center San Francisco Add to Google Calendar 2015 San Francisco Pride | Equality Without Exception
The whole city comes alive in a rainbow burst of excitement
at the 2015 San Francisco Pride Celebration
. 45th Annual San Francisco Pride Celebration
– Saturday, June 27, 2015 | Noon to 6 pm
– Sunday, June 28, 2015 | 11 am to 6:30 pm
Civic Center, San Francisco
FREE (The festival requests a $5-10 optional donation)
With over 200 parade contingents, 300 exhibitors
, and more than 20 stages
and venues, the San Francisco LGBT Pride Celebration and Parade is the largest LGBT gathering in the nation. Gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, queer and straight revelers fill up Civic Center for a weekend for concerts, DJs, performances and speeches
and the parade on Sunday morning.
The 2015 event theme is Equality Without Exception
.
There’s plenty of Pride spirit to spare with the Pink Saturday block party, plus happy hours and celebrations all around town. Sunday, June 28, 2015 2013 Pride Festival | Sunday

event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Fun & Games , Kids & Families , San Francisco , Walks & Tours Win: Ride The Ducks: Land & Ocean City Tour | SF Enter by: Friday, June 19, 2015 - 12:00 pm | Cost: WIN*
*Win a pair of tickets to Ride the Ducks. Regular cost: $37. Pre-booking is suggested. Add to Google Calendar
Enter to win a pair of tickets to Ride The Ducks
which will take you on a 90-minute tours of the city
, beginning at Fisherman’s Wharf and ending with a splash into the San Francisco Bay. The ducks visit many of San Francisco’s most sought after neighborhoods and attractions, including Union Square, Embarcadero, Ghirardelli Square, and AT&T Park.
For the first time in the company’s history, Ride The Ducks of San Francisco has transformed one of its boats into a rubber ducky replica, named “Daisy”
. Though we can’t guarantee that the Funcheap winner will get to ride Daisy, the boat will be available upon request for private charters and will be included in the rotation of tours held throughout the week, so you might still be a lucky-ducky. If you spot Daisy on the streets of the city or splashing down into the San Francisco Bay, snap a photo of the boat and include the hashtag #LuckyDuckSF on Facebook, Twitter, or Instagram and be entered to win free passes for Ride The Ducks. Win a pair of tickets from FuncheapSF Ride The Ducks: Land & Ocean City Tour | SF > > Enter your details below including address so we can mail the prize if you win. Good Luck! Don’t spend yer Friday sittin’ at home, chewin’ tobacco all on yer lonesome. C’mon down to the ole book place; bring yer dancin’ legs.
Alley Cat Bookstore and Gallery will be hosting the Feral Fourth Fridays Urban Square Dance
from 7-9 pm every 4th Friday night
.
All dances are fun, easy, and led by an actual caller, with live music by KC and the Moonshine Band
. They promise cheap beer and lots of dancing to get your weekend started on the right foot. They ask for a $5 – $10 donation. is many things – the fifth White Fence album, the first White Fence album to be recorded outside the bedroom fence (with live drumming), the first White Fence record to be produced for Drag City. Inevitably, the collision at the intersection of all these winding roads is a beautiful pileup of deep impacts, graceful lines and open space embodied in sound
, White on White, compacted for your eyes and ears to believe. San Francisco Rock Project, is SF’s only performance-based, rock-centric music school and is celebrating 5 years of helping kids make music.

event.name: Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Bayview
event.location: Southeast Wastewater Treatment Plant,| 750 Phelps St, San Francisco, CA
event.description: Tours alternate between the Oceanside Plant in the Outer Sunset and the Southeast Plant in Bayview.
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Geek Event , Lectures & Workshops , San Francisco Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Bayview Saturday, September 26, 2015 - 10:00 am to 12:30 pm | Cost: FREE*
*Free, but an RSVP is required. Southeast Wastewater Treatment Plant | 750 Phelps St, San Francisco, CA Bayview / Hunters Point San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Bayview
The San Francisco Public Utilities Commission invites you to take a free tour
of the city’s Wastewater Treatment Plant
to find out how your sewer system works. Free
, but an RSVP
is required at least two days in advance.
You’ll learn about the history of wastewater treatment
in San Francisco, tips on preventing pollution
of our bay and ocean, and best of all, you’ll get to go behind the scenes
to see how this vital piece of infrastructure works. Visitors must be at least 10 years old to take the tour.
Tours alternate between the Oceanside Plant
in the Outer Sunset and the Southeast Plant
in Bayview. event.name: Contemporary Jewish Museum Free Admission Day | First Tuesdays
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Art & Museums , Free Museum Day , San Francisco Contemporary Jewish Museum Free Admission Day | First Tuesdays Tuesday, August 4, 2015 - 11:00 am to 5:00 pm | Cost: FREE Add to Google Calendar Contemporary Jewish Museum Free Admission Day | First Tuesdays
The Contemporary Jewish Museum
engages audiences of all  backgrounds through dynamic exhibitions and programs that explore contemporary perspectives on Jewish culture
, history, art, and ideas. And the architecture of the Museum itself is a work of art.
Embracing a range of artistic disciplines
and media, the museum’s exhibition program includes contemporary art, historical objects, film, music, conversations, lectures, literary readings, and other live performances.
Normally admission is $12 for adults, but on the first Tuesday of each month
, admission is free. Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » *Top Pick* , San Francisco , Sports & Fitness San Francisco Midnight Mystery Ride | SF Saturday, July 18, 2015 - 11:59 pm | Cost: FREE Secret Location (SF) | San Francisco, CA San Francisco Add to Google Calendar San Francisco Midnight Mystery Ride | SF
Every third Saturday, you are invited to bicycle with the San Francisco Midnight Mystery Ride
as they set out to a new mystery location in SF. Where to meet?
They’ll post ride start locations on their website and Facebook page ,
the day of the ride only; there’s no advance warning. The ride happens every third Saturday. Participants are expected to:
Meet at a local bar before midnight on Saturday
Depart for a ride at midnight
Bring provisions for sharing at ride destination
Be awesome.
Ride start locations will be posted to their website the day of the ride. Only the ride leader knows where they’re going, so bring your sense of adventure. Rides are strictly NRLB (No Rider Left Behind)
and generally around 5 miles – all levels of cyclist are welcome. They ride rain or shine. event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Comedy , San Francisco , Sports & Fitness Free Laughter Yoga Class | UCSF Wednesday, October 14, 2015 - 5:30 pm to 6:30 pm | Cost: FREE UCSF Osher Center | 1545 Divisadero St, 5th Floor, San Francisco, CA Pacific Heights San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Free Laughter Yoga Class | UCSF Laughter
is contagious and has a powerful and immediate effect on our mind, body and spirit
. Laughter Yoga involves deep breathing, stretching, clapping and laughter exercises
and takes place on two Wednesdays each month from 5:30-6:30 pm. Free
, but an RSVP
is required.
The laughter exercises in this class aim to:
Increase blood flow and oxygen to all the major organs
Enhance endorphin levels which make us feel uplifted and can reduce pain
Stimulate immune, digestive and cardiac systems
Reduce stress levels
Relax, strengthen and lengthen the muscles with stretching
Help create a laughing community and be fun 2015 Laughter Yoga Class Dates

Fort Mason Center | Marina Blvd. and Buchanan St., San Francisco, CA Fort Mason San Francisco Add to Google Calendar “Off the Grid” Friday Night Food Truck Party | Fort Mason Over 30 food vendors in a huge circle with a full bar and bands in the middle? Now that’s a party; it’s also California’s largest weekly street food market. Off the Grid
is a weekly outdoor food truck bonanza
staged every Friday from 5-10 pm at the historic waterfront campus of Fort Mason Center.
In 2015, Off The Grid features 17 food trucks, 11 food tents, 2 dessert carts
, plus a cocktail bar, wine bar and beers
from Magnolia Brewery, all coming out to Fort Mason Center, rain or shine. Get your groove on to DJs from 5-7:30 pm
, and live bands from 8-10 pm
. Off the Grid Friday Night Food Truck Party
Every Friday | 5-10 pm*
Fort Mason, SF
FREE Admission *Seasonal – typically OtG closes during the winter and the 10 pm end time might change. Always check offthegrid.com first before attending. event.name: State-of-the-Art Green Building Tour | SF Public Utilities Office
event.location: SF Public Utilities HQ,| 525 Golden Ave, San Francisco, CA
event.description: Please Note: Please enter via the 525 Golden Gate Avenue entrance and check in at the security desk. All guests 18 years-old and above are requested to bring a valid government issued photo ID. Children and youth under 18 years of age are welcome, but must be accompanied by an adult or guardian. If you arrive late and your scheduled tour group has left the main floor, you will not be able to join that tour and will need to reschedule. If the Friday tour date you selected is cancelled, they will notify you via email on Thursday.

*Free, but an RSVP is required. Limited to maximum of 20 guests. Arrive 15 minutes prior to tour start time. SF Public Utilities HQ | 525 Golden Ave, San Francisco, CA Civic Center San Francisco Add to Google Calendar State-of-the-Art Green Building Tour | SF Public Utilities Office
Take a guided tour of one of the nation’s greenest office buildings
– the San Francisco Public Utilities Commission Headquarters (SFPUC), at 2 pm on every second Wednesday
of the month. Free
, but an RSVP
is required. L imited to maximum of 20 guests. Arrive 15 minutes prior to tour start time. Take an opportunity to visit this state-of-the-art 13-story, 277,500 square-feet building, designed and built to meet Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED) Platinum standards, exemplifying sustainable design and fiscal responsibility. Building Features
On-site wastewater treatment
On-site use of recycled wastewater
Rainwater harvesting
Solar panels
Wind turbines, and more Please Note: Please enter via the 525 Golden Gate Avenue entrance and check in at the security desk. All guests 18 years-old and above are requested to bring a valid government issued photo ID. Children and youth under 18 years of age are welcome, but must be accompanied by an adult or guardian. If you arrive late and your scheduled tour group has left the main floor, you will not be able to join that tour and will need to reschedule. If the Friday tour date you selected is cancelled, they will notify you via email on Thursday. event.name: 9th Annual Golden Gate Park Band Festival: 10 Band Extravaganza | SF
event.location: Spreckels Temple of Music,| Music Concourse Dr, San Francisco, CA
event.description: The Friends of the Golden Gate Park Band will provide two full days of free band concerts for the public on June 13 and 14, 2015, from 11am to 5pm, at the their ninth annual Golden Gate Park Band Festival . The festival will take place at the historic Spreckels “Temple of Music” band shell on the beautiful Music Concourse in Golden Gate Park, located between the de Young Museum and the California Academy of Sciences. Saturday, June 13, 2015 11:00 – Cupertino Symphonic Band, Cupertino Noon – San Jose Metropolitan Band, San Jose 1:00 – The CoolTones Big Band, Pleasanton 2:00 – West County Winds, San Pablo 3:00 – Diablo Regional Concert Band, Martinez 4:00 – West Bay Community Band, Millbrae Sunday, June 14, 2015 11:00 – Newark Symphonic Winds, Newark Noon – Los Angeles Symphonic Winds, Woodland Hills 1:00 – Golden Gate Park Band, San Francisco 2:00 – Golden Gate Park Band, San Francisco 3:00 – Pacific Brass Band, Salinas 4:00 – Deutscher Musikverein, San Francisco The featured band will be San Francisco’s world-famous, all-professional Golden Gate Park Band, now celebrating its 133rd birthday, older than the San Francisco Symphony by 30 years! The two days will be filled with a great variety of stirring band music encompassing marches, overtures, contemporary music, original band works, and popular classics.

Wirgler, presents the 133rd season in Golden Gate Park’s music concourse.
The weekly concerts take place most Sundays at 1 pm and are free and open to the public. All concerts feature music of specific nationalities or cultures,
including costumed guest performances from dancers, singers and speakers,
who will enlighten and entertain. Sunday, June 14, 2015 Golden Gate Park Band | Free Sunday Concert in the Park
The Friends of the Golden Gate Park Band will provide two full days of free band concerts for the public on June 13 and 14, 2015, from 11am to 5pm, at the their ninth annual Golden Gate Park Band Festival
. The festival will take place at the historic Spreckels “Temple of Music” band shell on the beautiful Music Concourse in Golden Gate Park, located between the de Young Museum and the California Academy of Sciences. Saturday, June 13, 2015

Celebrating the summer season and Marin’s love for the outdoors Town Center Corte Madera will host its annual Summer Music Series
each Sunday June 7th through September 27th from 2-4 pm with a great lineup of music that will appeal to all ages.

Good Vibrations (Polk St.) | 1620 Polk Street, San Francisco, CA Tenderloin San Francisco Add to Google Calendar SF’s “Antique Vibrator Museum” Free Guided Tour Day | Good Vibrations Did you know SF has an Antique Vibrator Museum?
Take a free tour
of this unique space every 3rd Sunday
of the month with Antique Vibrator Museum curator Dr. Carol Queen. Free
, but you must RSVP at least 72 hours in advance by calling the Polk St. store location at (415) 345-0400.
Your great-great-grandmother might have owned a vibrator, and the fascinating story of our favorite household helper
is truly stranger than fiction. Come see the Good Vibrations collection of vibrators, spanning the 20th century
, and learn all about their history. 2015 tour dates: January 18th, February 15th, March 15th, April 19th, May 17th, June 21st, July 19th, August 16th, September 20th, October 18th, November 15th, December 20th Upcoming SF’s “Antique Vibrator Museum” Free Guided Tour Day | Good Vibrations Events Sun 6/21 SF’s “Antique Vibrator Museum” Free Guided Tour Day | Good Vibrations Sun 7/19 SF’s “Antique Vibrator Museum” Free Guided Tour Day | Good Vibrations Report Error in Post Links: Event details Cost: FREE* *Free, but you must RSVP at least 72 hours in advance by calling the Polk St. store location at (415) 345-0400. event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Geek Event , Lectures & Workshops , San Francisco Oceanside Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Outer Sunset Saturday, July 11, 2015 - 10:00 am to 12:30 pm | Cost: FREE*
*Free, but an RSVP is required. Oceanside Wastewater Treatment Plant | 3500 Great Hwy, San Francisco, CA Sunset District San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Bayview
The San Francisco Public Utilities Commission invites you to take a free tour
of the city’s Wastewater Treatment Plant
to find out how your sewer system works. Free
, but an RSVP
is required at least two days in advance.
You’ll learn about the history of wastewater treatment
in San Francisco, tips on preventing pollution
of our bay and ocean, and best of all, you’ll get to go behind the scenes
to see how this vital piece of infrastructure works. Visitors must be at least 10 years old to take the tour.
Tours alternate between the Oceanside Plant
in the Outer Sunset and the Southeast Plant
in Bayview. *Mention FuncheapSF at the door and get 2-for-1 entry (so, $2.50 each), so grab a friend and get ready for some laughs. Otherwise, admission is $5 each. Oasis | 298 11th St, San Francisco, CA SoMa San Francisco Add to Google Calendar “Sh*t Talk” 2-for-1 Comedy & Cocktails Night | SF
Sh*t Talk is a monthly comedy show featuring professional comics and 2-for-1 drink specials
happening at Oasis on every 4th Wednesday
of the month.
The show is hosted by Yuri Kagan
who moved to San Francisco to get a degree in bad habits and telling jokes. Yuri is a dry-humor, observational, dead-pan comedian who talks about growing up with an entire family from the Soviet Union without holding anything back. Funcheap Deal:
Mention FuncheapSF at the door and get 2-for-1 entry (so, $2.50 each),
so grab a friend and get ready for some laughs. Otherwise, admission is $5 each. event.location: Civic Center (SF),| Fulton St and Larkin St, San Francisco, CA
event.description: 2015 World Cup Civic Center Watch Parties Schedule Fresh off the wildly popular World Cup soccer broadcasts at Civic Center Plaza, San Francisco Recreation and Parks and America SCORES Bay Area are teaming up again to bring you live broadcasts of Women’s World Cup soccer action at Civic Center Plaza.
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » *Top Pick* , Eating & Drinking , Kids & Families , San Francisco , Sports & Fitness , World Cup Women’s World Cup Final: Outdoor Watch Party & Soccer Festival | Civic Center Sunday, July 5, 2015 - 4:00 pm | Cost: FREE Civic Center (SF) | Fulton St and Larkin St, San Francisco, CA Civic Center San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Women’s World Cup: Outdoor Watch Party & Soccer Festival | Civic Center
Watch the best women soccer players from around the globe
battle it out to see who’s the best during the Women’s World Cup
.
Cheer along with a big crowd
in San Francisco’s Civic Center Plaza as the games are simulcast live
from Canada.
Along with watching the games on the big screen
, fans will be able to get their faces painted in team colors, scrimmage on mini soccer courts
, and take part in soccer skill activities
provided by Soccer in Slow Motion.
There will be gourmet food trucks from Off the Grid
and more. 2015 World Cup Civic Center Watch Parties Schedule
Team USA v. Sweden – June 12 | 5 pm (activities starting at 4 pm)
Semifinal – June 30 | 4 pm
World Cup Final – July 5 | 4 pm

Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Comedy , San Francisco Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Monday, August 10, 2015 - 8:00 pm | Cost: FREE Milk Bar | 1840 Haight Street, San Francisco, CA Upper Haight San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF The Something Something Shindig
is a wild show that combines stand up comedy, improv, music
, and what they like to call “audience-participation-good-times”
typically happening at 8 pm every second Monday
.
The emcees for the evening are Justin Gomes and Andrew Moore. True fans of debauchery
, they’ve been co-hosting shows for years in a yin-and-yang mix of chaos and order that always yields the same results: party times. About Something Something Shindig:
A comedian will perform stand up comedy
After said comedian’s set, they will perform improv with hosts Andrew and Justin
Occasionally they will throw in big group games, audience shindigs, and weird stuff
Rinse, Repeat, Good Times Ensue Upcoming Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Events Mon 7/13 Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Mon 8/10 Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Mon 9/14 Something Something Shindig: Improv Comedy & Music | SF Report Error in Post Links: Event details Cost: FREE SHARE THIS POST Tweet 0

event.location: Southeast Wastewater Treatment Plant,| 750 Phelps St, San Francisco, CA
event.description: Tours alternate between the Oceanside Plant in the Outer Sunset and the Southeast Plant in Bayview.
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Geek Event , Lectures & Workshops , San Francisco Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Bayview Saturday, October 24, 2015 - 10:00 am to 12:30 pm | Cost: FREE*
*Free, but an RSVP is required. Southeast Wastewater Treatment Plant | 750 Phelps St, San Francisco, CA Bayview / Hunters Point San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Bayview
The San Francisco Public Utilities Commission invites you to take a free tour
of the city’s Wastewater Treatment Plant
to find out how your sewer system works. Free
, but an RSVP
is required at least two days in advance.
You’ll learn about the history of wastewater treatment
in San Francisco, tips on preventing pollution
of our bay and ocean, and best of all, you’ll get to go behind the scenes
to see how this vital piece of infrastructure works. Visitors must be at least 10 years old to take the tour.
Tours alternate between the Oceanside Plant
in the Outer Sunset and the Southeast Plant
in Bayview. Sh*t Talk is a monthly comedy show featuring professional comics and 2-for-1 drink specials
happening at Oasis on every 4th Wednesday
of the month.
The show is hosted by Yuri Kagan
who moved to San Francisco to get a degree in bad habits and telling jokes. Yuri is a dry-humor, observational, dead-pan comedian who talks about growing up with an entire family from the Soviet Union without holding anything back. Funcheap Deal:

so grab a friend and get ready for some laughs. Otherwise, admission is $5 each. Wednesday, June 24, 2015 “Sh*t Talk” 2-for-1 Comedy & Cocktails Night | SF
In June Sh*t Talk hosts the comic talents of George Chen, Zack Chapalone, Jennifer Dronsky, Butch Escobar and Morgan.

event.description: 2015 Laughter Yoga Class Dates
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Comedy , San Francisco , Sports & Fitness Free Laughter Yoga Class | UCSF Wednesday, October 28, 2015 - 5:30 pm to 6:30 pm | Cost: FREE UCSF Osher Center | 1545 Divisadero St, 5th Floor, San Francisco, CA Pacific Heights San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Free Laughter Yoga Class | UCSF Laughter
is contagious and has a powerful and immediate effect on our mind, body and spirit
. Laughter Yoga involves deep breathing, stretching, clapping and laughter exercises
and takes place on two Wednesdays each month from 5:30-6:30 pm. Free
, but an RSVP
is required.
The laughter exercises in this class aim to:
Increase blood flow and oxygen to all the major organs
Enhance endorphin levels which make us feel uplifted and can reduce pain
Stimulate immune, digestive and cardiac systems
Reduce stress levels
Relax, strengthen and lengthen the muscles with stretching
Help create a laughing community and be fun 2015 Laughter Yoga Class Dates

is a monthly, live performance-based poetry anthology that tries to find the best art at the intersection of page and stage,
mixing local and national touring poets.
Every third Monday, it’s a poetry competition with a twist. Editors are chosen at random from the audience
before each show, and those editors decide which poets and poems will appear in Tandem, the annual publication created over the course of the season. The Lit Slam
Every Third Monday | Q&A Discussion at 7 pm; show at 8 pm

*Entrance is free. Donations and proceeds from swag will be donated to a local dog rescue organization. Dolores Park | 19th Street and Dolores Street, San Francisco, CA Mission District San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Poochella 2015
, San Francisco’s own dog festival hits Dolores Park, so come out and chill, listen to music, make friends, eat delicious food, and participate in, or watch some epic pooch festivities
– all for a good cause. Poochella 2015
Saturday, July 18, 2015 | 1 pm
Dolores Park, San Francisco
FREE Festivities include:
Pooch Photobooth (Take pictures and create gifs with your pooch)
Pooch Awards (Best dog costume owner/dog lookalike, etc)
Pooch Show (Cutest pup, pudgie pooch, etc)
Local dog pound (Play with pups or adopt one)
Music (TBA)
Food trucks and local food vendors to enlighten the taste buds.
The purpose of Poochella is to create an event for the wonderful dogs of San Francisco, with the proceeds going right back into the community. Everyone is invited. is one of the Bay Area’s premier venues for adventurous art
. A multidisciplinary art center, the YBCA features exhibitions, performance, film/video, and community engagement programs, along with rotating art exhibits with a focus on contemporary and emerging art
from the Bay Area and beyond.
Normally admission is $10 for adults, but on the first Tuesday of each month
admission is free. Other Discounts:
$2 discount on gallery admission with a valid public transportation pass or transfer, or a public library card.
Ticket discounts for seniors, students and teachers with a valid I.D. “Misery Index” is a free, monthly show
that brings together some of the most pessimistic, neurotic and dysfunctional
individuals on the face of the planet: stand-up comedians.
Take the edge off with cheap drinks and free laughs as these choleric comics direct their disdain towards all of society’s growing ills, hosted by comedienne, Jane Harrison
. The Rite Spot is a cozy Mission dive that features local bands, comedians and performers. Upcoming “Misery Index” Dysfunctional Comedy Night | Mission Dist. Join Ariel Mihic of the YogaSlackers for an AcroYoga
playshop from 10-10:50 am on most first Sundays of every month
in the Grotto at Sports Basement Bryant in San Francisco. Free
, but an RSVP
is required.
AcroYoga is a combination of yoga
, acrobatics
, and Thai massage
. This workshop will give you a taste of all of these elements while you work with partners to build a new sense of communication, trust, and community.
All levels are welcome and no partner is necessary
. This session will provide a safe environment for beginners, and also an opportunity for more experienced folks to sharpen their skills. 2015 Acroyoga Dates

is a monthly outing of art, performance, music, and drinks
in the Yerba Buena neighborhood in the heart of downtown San Francisco, between 2nd and 5th Street, and Market and Harrison Street. Free

is recommended to save time at check-in. Pre-register, and use your smart phone or printed ticket to get wristbands at participating art venues.
Yerba Buena neighborhood galleries, museums, restaurants, and bars will host an event every third Thursday of the month which will be an exciting chance to explore the Yerba Buena district.

for special rates at participating bars and restaurants. All gallery and museum admissions will be free,

event.location: Secret Location (SF),| San Francisco, CA
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » *Top Pick* , San Francisco , Sports & Fitness San Francisco Midnight Mystery Ride | SF Saturday, June 20, 2015 - 11:59 pm | Cost: FREE Secret Location (SF) | San Francisco, CA San Francisco Add to Google Calendar San Francisco Midnight Mystery Ride | SF
Every third Saturday, you are invited to bicycle with the San Francisco Midnight Mystery Ride
as they set out to a new mystery location in SF. Where to meet?
They’ll post ride start locations on their website and Facebook page ,
the day of the ride only; there’s no advance warning. The ride happens every third Saturday. Participants are expected to:
Meet at a local bar before midnight on Saturday
Depart for a ride at midnight
Bring provisions for sharing at ride destination
Be awesome.
Ride start locations will be posted to their website the day of the ride. Only the ride leader knows where they’re going, so bring your sense of adventure. Rides are strictly NRLB (No Rider Left Behind)
and generally around 5 miles – all levels of cyclist are welcome. They ride rain or shine. event.name: 2015 San Francisco Pride Parade
event.location: Market Street,| Market Street and Montgomery Street, San Francisco, CA
event.description: Art meets politics  in a fleet of floats, vehicles, and marchers along Market Street during the San Francisco Pride Parade , one the nation’s largest LGBT events , starting at 10:30 am on Pride Sunday. Bring a rainbow flag and come cheer on  dykes on bikes, bears in straps, trannies in gowns,  and others from SF’s colorful LGBT community. The parade is the culmination of a month of Pride-themed events in the city, leading up to an all-out celebration for Pride weekend with the  Pride Festival in Civic Center Plaza. (Please Note: Sadly, the Pink Saturday party has been canceled for 2015.)
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » **Annual Event** , *Top Pick* , Fairs & Festivals , KFOG , Pride , San Francisco , San FranFREEsco 2015 San Francisco Pride Parade Sunday, June 28, 2015 - 10:30 am | Cost: FREE Market Street | Market Street and Montgomery Street, San Francisco, CA Financial District San Francisco Add to Google Calendar 2015 San Francisco Pride | Equality Without Exception
The whole city comes alive in a rainbow burst of excitement
at the 2015 San Francisco Pride Celebration
. 45th Annual San Francisco Pride Celebration
– Saturday, June 27, 2015 | Noon to 6 pm
– Sunday, June 28, 2015 | 11 am to 6:30 pm
Civic Center, San Francisco
FREE (The festival requests a $5-10 optional donation)
With over 200 parade contingents, 300 exhibitors
, and more than 20 stages
and venues, the San Francisco LGBT Pride Celebration and Parade is the largest LGBT gathering in the nation. Gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, queer and straight revelers fill up Civic Center for a weekend for concerts, DJs, performances and speeches
and the parade on Sunday morning.
The 2015 event theme is Equality Without Exception
.
There’s plenty of Pride spirit to spare with the Pink Saturday block party, plus happy hours and celebrations all around town. Sunday, June 28, 2015 2015 San Francisco Pride | Equality Without Exception Art meets politics
in a fleet of floats, vehicles, and marchers along Market Street during the San Francisco Pride Parade
, one the nation’s largest LGBT events
, starting at 10:30 am on Pride Sunday.
Bring a rainbow flag and come cheer on dykes on bikes, bears in straps, trannies in gowns,
and others from SF’s colorful LGBT community.
The parade is the culmination of a month of Pride-themed events in the city, leading up to an all-out celebration for Pride weekend
with the Pride Festival
in Civic Center Plaza. (Please Note: Sadly, the Pink Saturday party has been canceled for 2015.) 2015 San Francisco Pride Parade
Sunday, June 28, 2015 | 10:30 am
Market Street, San Francisco
FREE
The theme for the 45th annual celebration is “Equality Without Exception.” Celebrate with over 200 parade contingents, 300 exhibitors
, and nearly two dozen community-run stages and venues.
The parade kicks off at 10:30 am at Market and Beale and ends at Market and 8th in downtown San Francisco. ( Map

Good Vibrations (Polk St.) | 1620 Polk Street, San Francisco, CA Tenderloin San Francisco Add to Google Calendar SF’s “Antique Vibrator Museum” Free Guided Tour Day | Good Vibrations Did you know SF has an Antique Vibrator Museum?
Take a free tour
of this unique space every 3rd Sunday
of the month with Antique Vibrator Museum curator Dr. Carol Queen. Free
, but you must RSVP at least 72 hours in advance by calling the Polk St. store location at (415) 345-0400.
Your great-great-grandmother might have owned a vibrator, and the fascinating story of our favorite household helper
is truly stranger than fiction. Come see the Good Vibrations collection of vibrators, spanning the 20th century
, and learn all about their history. 2015 tour dates: January 18th, February 15th, March 15th, April 19th, May 17th, June 21st, July 19th, August 16th, September 20th, October 18th, November 15th, December 20th Upcoming SF’s “Antique Vibrator Museum” Free Guided Tour Day | Good Vibrations Events Sun 6/21 SF’s “Antique Vibrator Museum” Free Guided Tour Day | Good Vibrations Sun 7/19 SF’s “Antique Vibrator Museum” Free Guided Tour Day | Good Vibrations Report Error in Post Links: Event details Cost: FREE* *Free, but you must RSVP at least 72 hours in advance by calling the Polk St. store location at (415) 345-0400. *Clinic is by donation. Flourish Studio | 2601 Mission St, Suite 404, San Francisco, CA Mission District San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Community Reiki Clinic: Relaxation & Balance | Mission Dist. Curious about Reiki?
This free clinic is open to anyone who would like to learn about and experience the benefits of Reiki.
The goal of Reiki is to promote deep relaxation and balance
through hands on touch. The immune response lives in the skin and white blood cell activity increases with touch. Reiki fortifies our ability to heal by calming the cardiovascular system and creating a state of coherence.
The clinics are by donation
and take place from 6-8 pm on the second Friday of the month
from May to October 2015. Upcoming Community Reiki Clinic: Relaxation & Balance | Mission Dist. Events Fri 7/10 Community Reiki Clinic: Relaxation & Balance | Mission Dist. event.name: The Beatles Choir: Volunteer Singalong | SF
event.location: Laguna Honda Hospital,| 375 Laguna Honda Blvd, San Francisco, CA
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Charity & Volunteering , Fun & Games , Live Music , San Francisco , Theater & Performance The Beatles Choir: Volunteer Singalong | SF Saturday, June 27, 2015 - 9:30 am | Cost: FREE*
*Free, but an RSVP is recommended. Laguna Honda Hospital | 375 Laguna Honda Blvd, San Francisco, CA Forest Hill San Francisco Add to Google Calendar The Beatles Choir: Volunteer Singalong | SF
Take a sad song and make it better as The Beatles Choir
brings cheer to the residents and staff of Laguna Honda Hospital through music, joy, laughter and the timeless songs of the Fab Four
. Laguna Honda Hospital is a long-term, skilled nursing and rehabilitation center, committed to serving seniors and adults with disabilities living in San Francisco. Want to sing?
Beatles Choir members of all ages are welcome to come join in song and be a part of the event. Come dressed in a black shirt and join Beatles Choir directors, Matt Ridenour and Christie Chew in the Laguna Honda lobby at 9:30 am to rehearse
before touring around the hospital. Free
, but an RSVP
is recommended. Please note , the event itself is not religious, but The Beatles Choir is associated with City Hope (social justice arm of City Church of San Francisco). Need a little practice? Beatles Karaoke Night

event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Comedy , San Francisco , Sports & Fitness Free Laughter Yoga Class | UCSF Wednesday, August 12, 2015 - 5:30 pm to 6:30 pm | Cost: FREE UCSF Osher Center | 1545 Divisadero St, 5th Floor, San Francisco, CA Pacific Heights San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Free Laughter Yoga Class | UCSF Laughter
is contagious and has a powerful and immediate effect on our mind, body and spirit
. Laughter Yoga involves deep breathing, stretching, clapping and laughter exercises
and takes place on two Wednesdays each month from 5:30-6:30 pm. Free
, but an RSVP
is required.
The laughter exercises in this class aim to:
Increase blood flow and oxygen to all the major organs
Enhance endorphin levels which make us feel uplifted and can reduce pain
Stimulate immune, digestive and cardiac systems
Reduce stress levels
Relax, strengthen and lengthen the muscles with stretching
Help create a laughing community and be fun 2015 Laughter Yoga Class Dates

is contagious and has a powerful and immediate effect on our mind, body and spirit
. Laughter Yoga involves deep breathing, stretching, clapping and laughter exercises
and takes place on two Wednesdays each month from 5:30-6:30 pm. Free
, but an RSVP
is required.
The laughter exercises in this class aim to:
Increase blood flow and oxygen to all the major organs
Enhance endorphin levels which make us feel uplifted and can reduce pain
Stimulate immune, digestive and cardiac systems
Reduce stress levels
Relax, strengthen and lengthen the muscles with stretching
Help create a laughing community and be fun 2015 Laughter Yoga Class Dates

event.name: Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Bayview
event.location: Southeast Wastewater Treatment Plant,| 750 Phelps St, San Francisco, CA
event.description: Tours alternate between the Oceanside Plant in the Outer Sunset and the Southeast Plant in Bayview.
event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Geek Event , Lectures & Workshops , San Francisco Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Bayview Saturday, July 25, 2015 - 10:00 am to 12:30 pm | Cost: FREE*
*Free, but an RSVP is required. Southeast Wastewater Treatment Plant | 750 Phelps St, San Francisco, CA Bayview / Hunters Point San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Wastewater Treatment Plant Tour | Bayview
The San Francisco Public Utilities Commission invites you to take a free tour
of the city’s Wastewater Treatment Plant
to find out how your sewer system works. Free
, but an RSVP
is required at least two days in advance.
You’ll learn about the history of wastewater treatment
in San Francisco, tips on preventing pollution
of our bay and ocean, and best of all, you’ll get to go behind the scenes
to see how this vital piece of infrastructure works. Visitors must be at least 10 years old to take the tour.
Tours alternate between the Oceanside Plant
in the Outer Sunset and the Southeast Plant
in Bayview. event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » *Top Pick* , Eating & Drinking , Fun & Games , San Francisco Casper Snooze Bar: Coffee, Waffles & Dream Interpretations | SF Sunday, June 14, 2015 - All Day | Cost: FREE*
*Free, but you must book an appointment. Casper Snooze Bar | 414 Jackson St, San Francisco, CA Financial District San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Casper Snooze Bar: Coffee, Waffles & Dream Interpretations | SF
Come out to a 5-day celebration of sleep
and a play on morning’s best friend – the snooze button – from 11 am to 8 pm
on June 10-14, 2015
organized by mattress makers, Casper. Free
, but you must book an appointment
.
During the day, the Snooze Bar will be a pop-up experience with a coffee bar, waffle station, room for naps, and an artist to interpret dreams
. Once the sun sets, the space transforms into the dreamiest bar in town
. It’s a night out to celebrate sleeping in- complete with nightcaps, twilight tunes, and dream interpretations
. Upcoming Casper Snooze Bar: Coffee, Waffles & Dream Interpretations | SF Events Sun 6/14 Casper Snooze Bar: Coffee, Waffles & Dream Interpretations | SF Report Error in Post Links: Event details Cost: FREE* *Free, but you must book an appointment. SHARE THIS POST Tweet 0

event.dump:
Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » Charity & Volunteering , Fun & Games , Live Music , San Francisco , Theater & Performance The Beatles Choir: Volunteer Singalong | SF Saturday, July 25, 2015 - 9:30 am | Cost: FREE*
*Free, but an RSVP is recommended. Laguna Honda Hospital | 375 Laguna Honda Blvd, San Francisco, CA Forest Hill San Francisco Add to Google Calendar The Beatles Choir: Volunteer Singalong | SF
Take a sad song and make it better as The Beatles Choir
brings cheer to the residents and staff of Laguna Honda Hospital through music, joy, laughter and the timeless songs of the Fab Four
. Laguna Honda Hospital is a long-term, skilled nursing and rehabilitation center, committed to serving seniors and adults with disabilities living in San Francisco. Want to sing?
Beatles Choir members of all ages are welcome to come join in song and be a part of the event. Come dressed in a black shirt and join Beatles Choir directors, Matt Ridenour and Christie Chew in the Laguna Honda lobby at 9:30 am to rehearse
before touring around the hospital. Free
, but an RSVP
is recommended. Please note , the event itself is not religious, but The Beatles Choir is associated with City Hope (social justice arm of City Church of San Francisco). Need a little practice? Beatles Karaoke Night
happens on every first Monday of the month at The Royale in the Tendernob. Home Upcoming Events Top Picks of the Week San Francisco Calendar East Bay Calendar Bay Area Calendar Free Today Weekend Email Win Stuff Add Your Event Advertise Submission Guidelines Home » *Top Pick* , Kids & Families , Live Music , Recurring - Monthly , San Francisco Sea Chantey Sing Along Aboard Historic Ship | SF Saturday, July 11, 2015 - 8:00 pm to 12:00 am | Cost: FREE*
*RSVP required 415-561-7171 or peter_kasin@nps.gov, Bring a mug for cider SF Maritime National Historical Park | 499 Jefferson St., San Francisco, CA Fisherman’s Wharf San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Sea Chantey Sing Along Aboard Historic Ship | SF
Sailors and scallywags alike gather around for an evening of traditional sea songs and chanteys
for the San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park’s monthly chantey on the first Saturday night of each month
at 8 pm.
Park rangers will lead the public in traditional sea-faring tunes with lots of socializing aboard an historic ship.
The evening includes free hot cider
for singers (that means you)
.
So make sure to RSVP
by calling 415-561-7171 or emailing peter_kasin@nps.gov
. Bring a mug
for the cider and don’t forget warm clothes for an evening of sailor songs
under the stars. San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park (499 Jefferson St., SF) | First Saturday of the month | 8 pm-Midnight | FREE with RSVP Saturday, July 11, 2015 Sea Chantey Sing Along Aboard Historic Ship | SF
Please note the July 2015 sea chanty singalong is July 11th (not July 4th) due to the holiday. *Free, but an RSVP is required. Sports Basement (Bryant St.) | 1590 Bryant Street, San Francisco, CA Mission District San Francisco Add to Google Calendar Free AcroYoga Workshop | Sports Basement Bryant
Join Ariel Mihic of the YogaSlackers for an AcroYoga
playshop from 10-10:50 am on most first Sundays of every month
in the Grotto at Sports Basement Bryant in San Francisco. Free
, but an RSVP
is required.
AcroYoga is a combination of yoga
, acrobatics
, and Thai massage
. This workshop will give you a taste of all of these elements while you work with partners to build a new sense of communication, trust, and community.
All levels are welcome and no partner is necessary
. This session will provide a safe environment for beginners, and also an opportunity for more experienced folks to sharpen their skills. 2015 Acroyoga Dates
Sun 2/1
